title: An introduction to open-source music production software (live with HKU.nl)

media:group.media:title: An introduction to open-source music production software (live with HKU.nl)
media:group.media:description:
--- LINKS:

- My videos that will teach you Ardour:
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLi2LbJnGR-49PM2Pbs46zySEO-7tBsBsI

- Huge thanks to Marc and HKU for invitating me to give this presentation to their students! And thanks to everyone who attended the session!
https://www.hku.nl/

--- TIMESTAMPS (contributed by Brian Fields):

0:00  Intro, About, and Open Source Software
12:30 Example
14:40 Ardour
16:20 Synth Drums: Geonkick
25:10 Sampled Drums - AVL Drumkits
42:55 Tangent: Carla / Audio processing
55:15 Back to AVL Drumkits
57:53 Synth: Odin II  
1:10:18 Synth: Vitalium
1:39:35 Synth: Cardinal
1:58:00 Wrap-up and Q&A

--- OTHER INFO:

This video was produced exclusively with open-source software and GNU/Linux.

- Studio software:
https://archlinux.org (operating system)
https://www.kde.org/plasma-desktop (desktop environment)
https://www.olivevideoeditor.org/ (v. 0.1.2; video editing)
https://obsproject.com/ (video capture / streaming)
https://www.maartenbaert.be/simplescreenrecorder/ (additional screen capture)
https://www.blender.org/ (3d art and animation)
https://inkscape.org/ (2d vector art and thumbnail images)
https://gimp.org/ (photo manipulation)
https://kx.studio/Applications:Carla (live audio processing)
Audacity [pre MuseGroup version] (final audio touchup and level control)

- Studio hardware:
CPU: AMD Ryzen 9 3900X
GPU: AMD Radeon RX 6800X
Mobo: Gigabyte B550 AORUS ELITE V2
Audio I/F: PreSonus Studio24C
Mics: Behringer B-1 (condenser); Shure SM57 (dynamic) + A2WS; Boya BY-M1 (lavalier)
Main cam: Panasonic Lumix GH5
Top cam: Logitech C920
Aux cam: OnePlus 5T

MIDI controller: M-Audio Oxygen 49 MKIV
Coffee machine: DeLonghi ECP33.21
Mug: https://is.gd/unfamug

---

Now go, make some music!
